items.title: Quarterly Newsletter - June 2025
items.summary: Geospatial Data Science Group Quarterly Newsletter School of Geographical & Earth Sciences | University of Glasgow Q2 2025 ğŸ‘‹ Welcome…
items.content_html:
Geospatial Data Science Group Quarterly Newsletter
School of Geographical & Earth Sciences | University of Glasgow
Q2 2025

ğŸ‘‹ Welcome Note
Dear colleagues, collaborators, and friends,

As we wrapped up another exciting quarter, we looked back at an incredibly productive and impactful few months for the Geospatial Data Science Group (GDSG). From major conference appearances and award-winning papers to impactful public talks and new research outputs, our interdisciplinary team continues to advance the boundaries of geospatial data science.

Thank you for being part of our growing community!

â€” The GDSG Communications Team

ğŸ›°ï¸ Research Highlights

â€¢ Â  Â Best Paper Award at LBS 2025 ğŸ†
Anahid Basiri and Joe Shingleton were awarded Best Paper at LBS 2025 for:
â€œGeospatial Data Quality in the Era of Generative AI: Can We Trust the Geographic Information Produced by Large Language Models?â€
Their work addressed the pressing challenge of assessing trust in AI-generated geospatial information.

â€¢ Â  Â Finalists at AGILE 2025
Anahid Basiri and Joe Shingleton were finalists for Best Paper at AGILE 2025 with:
â€œHow close is â€˜closeâ€™? An analysis of the spatial characteristics of perceived proximity using Large Language Modelsâ€
The paper was presented during the Best Paper Session on Friday, 13 June.

New Publication in Mathematics: â€œExploring a Diagnostic Test for Missingness at Randomâ€
Dominick Sutton, Anahid Basiri & Ziqi Li
This open-access study investigated the potential for a new diagnostic test to identify when data is missing at random. Although the test fell short of practical use, the paper introduced a thought-provoking extension to standard missing data classifications.
ğŸ‘‰ Read the paper

ğŸŒ Impact & Engagement

Ongoing UX Research on Missing Data Visualisation
Merve Polat Kayali launched a survey building on Anthony Robinsonâ€™s work, investigating how users interpret and interact with missing data on maps.
ğŸ—ºï¸ Take the survey: https://lnkd.in/grcemKec

â€¢ Â  Â Ana Basiri Spoke at the Scottish Parliament
Prof. Ana Basiri contributed expert testimony during a parliamentary session on AI and the UK-EU Trade & Cooperation Agreement, held at Holyrood.
ğŸ“º Watch the full session

â€¢ Â  Â Public Lecture: â€œBig Data, Bigger Holesâ€
On Thursday, 5 June, Prof. Basiri delivered a well-attended talk at the ARC, University of Glasgow, discussing the power and implications of missing data.
ğŸŸï¸ Event link

â€¢ Â  Â Ongoing UX Research on Missing Data Visualisation
Merve Polat Kayali launched a survey exploring how users interact with and interpret missing data on maps, building on Anthony Robinsonâ€™s work. The study aimed to better understand user perception of absence and uncertainty in geospatial contexts.
ğŸ—ºï¸ Take the survey

ğŸ§­ Team News
Quarterly Away Day
The GDSG team gathered for our quarterly Lab Away Day, featuring presentations from each team member on their latest research.

Team Spotlight: Prof. Ana Basiri
As Professor of Geospatial Data Science, Director of the Centre for Data Science & AI, and UKRI Future Leaders Fellow, Ana Basiri led our group with a commitment to tackling bias, data unavailability, and complexity in location-based services.
#InclusiveTech #FutureLeaders #SmartDecisions

ğŸ—“ï¸ Past Events & Milestones

Keynotes at LBS 2025 (Finland)
Prof. Ana Basiri delivered a keynote, and Joe Shingleton presented on geospatial data quality in generative AI contexts.

ğŸ”— Stay Connected
ğŸŒ Website: https://gdsglasgow.github.io/
LinkedIn:
ğŸ¦ Twitter/X: https://x.com/GSDSglasgow

items.title: AGILE 2025
items.summary: Our team was at the Association of Geographic Laboratories in Europe (AGILE) Conference: on 10th June to 13th June 2025,…
items.content_html: Our team was at the Association of Geographic Laboratories in Europe (AGILE) Conference: on 10th June to 13th June 2025, Dresden, Gemany.

items.title: GeoTools
items.summary: Find out more at: https://geotools.org/ "GeoTools is an open source (LGPL) Java code library which provides standards compliant methods for…
items.content_html:
Find out more at: https://geotools.org/

"GeoTools is an open source (LGPL) Java code library which provides standards compliant methods for the manipulation of geospatial data, for example to implement Geographic Information Systems (GIS). The GeoTools library implements Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) specifications as they are developed."

items.title: MapAction
items.summary: MapAction knows that providing geospatial expertise to humanitarian situations can greatly improve outcomes for the people affected. Over 20 years,…
items.content_html:
MapAction knows that providing geospatial expertise to humanitarian situations can greatly improve outcomes for the people affected.

Over 20 years, in 140+ humanitarian emergencies in 80 countries as well as many hundreds of disaster preparedness events, MapAction has provided disaster response agencies with the mapping, geospatial and data capabilities necessary to make the vital decisions to support vast numbers of people.

Find out more at https://mapaction.org/about-us/:Â

items.title: GeoServer
items.summary: GeoServer is an open source server for sharing geospatial data. GeoServer is a Java-based server that allows users to view…
items.content_html:
GeoServer is an open source server for sharing geospatial data.

GeoServer is a Java-based server that allows users to view and edit geospatial data. Using open standards set forth by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC), GeoServer allows for great flexibility in map creation and data sharing.

Find out more at https://geoserver.org

items.title: Urban Big Data Centre (UBDC)
items.summary: Find at more at https://www.ubdc.ac.uk: Supported by the Economic and Social Research Council and the University of Glasgow, the Urban…
items.content_html:
Find at more at https://www.ubdc.ac.uk:

Supported by the Economic and Social Research Council and the University of Glasgow, the Urban Big Data Centre is a dynamic national research hub and data service, championing the use of smart data to inform policymaking and enhance the quality of urban life.Â

items.title: The Alan Turing Institute â€“ Roche Strategic Partnership
items.summary: Find out more at https://www.turing.ac.uk/research/research-projects/alan-turing-institute-roche-strategic-partnership : "The Alan Turing Institute, headquartered in the British Library, London, was created as the…
items.content_html:
Find out more at https://www.turing.ac.uk/research/research-projects/alan-turing-institute-roche-strategic-partnership :Â 

Professor Ana Basiri, Academic Director of the Geospatial Data Science Group, is the Turing Network Development Award Lead

"The Alan Turing Institute, headquartered in the British Library, London, was created as the national institute for data science in 2015. In 2017, as a result of a government recommendation, we added artificial intelligence to our remit.â€¯Â 

The Institute is named in honour ofâ€¯Alan Turingâ€¯(23 June 1912â€¯â€“ 7 June 1954), whose pioneering work in theoretical and applied mathematics, engineering and computing are considered to be the key disciplines comprising the fields of data science and artificial intelligence."

items.title: UrbanOccupationsOETR
items.summary: This project aims to overcome historiographical and disciplinary limitations in social and economic history, historical geography and urban studies for…
items.content_html:
This project aims to overcome historiographical and disciplinary limitations in social and economic history, historical geography and urban studies for the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of TÃ¼rkiye. The chosen long-term Ottoman/Turkish perspective is intended to facilitate comparative approaches so as to overcome the limitations of national historiographies. By extending the analysis up to 2000 the project also challenges the disciplinary divide between economic history, economics and urban studies in research on TÃ¼rkiye.

Find out more at https://urbanoccupations.ku.edu.tr
